DataElement.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Case Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A study specific unique identifier for the case.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Case Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs)._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._A problem requiring investigation._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Case
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:A problem requiring investigation.

Concepts.definition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
